book:
REST API Development By Example A complete guide to building usable, scalable, and secure RESTful systems
Ray Sinnema
2015
Getting Started
The first part of the book establishes what REST APIs are and why we need them () and how to capture requirements placed upon them ().
This mostly theoretical part lays the foundation for the more practical parts that follow.
Designing REST APIs
This part of the book talks about all the different aspects of designing a REST API. We explain in detail how to design a REST API (), including using common design constructs (), handling exceptional cases (), and designing for good performance () and security (). We end with a discussion on API design tooling ().
Implementing REST APIs
This part of the book explains how to turn an API design into a fully functional implementation () that meets expectations (). We'll also look at running the implementation () and changing it over time ().
Using REST APIs
In the final part of the book we come full circle by switching the perspective back from the server to the client and from building an API to consuming it ().
